title: Moral Leadership and Ubiquitous Learning Design Utilizing Cultural Storytelling

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Blended learning design combining mobile-based interactions with face-to-face discussions, applying cultural motifs to modern leadership case studies.

learning_goals: Learners can derive a moral decision-making framework through cultural storytelling analysis.

Learners complete a 2-week collaborative problem-solving project with three team members in a ubiquitous learning environment (online collaboration tools, mobile platforms, etc.) and achieve an average score of 4 or higher (on a 5-point scale) on a leadership competency rubric (5 items: communication, decision-making, team motivation, etc.).
Learners can interpret indicators of moral growth by analyzing data generated on digital platforms.
Learners establish action plans to apply the symbolism of cultural archetypes to modern organizational leadership cases.

resources: Digital Journaling Tool for Reflective Thinking

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
